question.text: I'm calling about the Jeep Liberty.

option.answerText: Yes, that's a great vehicle.
Would you like to drive it?
Yes, sir.

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'C,' 'Yes, sir.' The best approach is to simply respond to the caller-not volunteer an opinion or ask another question.

question.text: What package comes with power windows and locks?

option.answerText: We have many great packages available.
All models.
What other options are you interested in?

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'B,' 'All models.' By simply answering the caller's question, you are building good will and continuing the dialogue.

question.text: What colors does it come in?

option.answerText: We have all available colors.
What color are you looking for?
The green is nice.

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'A,' 'We have all available colors.' Remember that the caller is looking for answers-not questions, and not your opinion.

question.text: I'm thinking about leasing. What kind of payment am I looking at?

option.answerText: What do you want to spend?
That vehicle is a great value!
Your payment on a 36-month lease would be around $425 a month.

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'C,' 'Your payment on a 36-month lease would be around $425 a month.' This response provides the caller with the information he is seeking.

option.answerText: You're welcome.
When can you come in?
Ah, sir?

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'C,' 'Ah, sir?' This is the appropriate time in the call to use the FREEZE technique-to slow the conversation down so that you can move toward getting the appointment.

option.answerText: My name's _________; what's yours?
When would you like to drive one?
That vehicle's selling fast!

answer.incorrectText: That's incorrect. The correct response is 'B,' 'When would you like to drive one?' This is the CLOSE step, during which you invite the customer to visit the showroom.

question.text: I don't want or need a demo drive.

option.answerText: I'd be happy to bring it to you so you can see it. When would be a good time?
But you really have to drive it to appreciate it!
Okay. Thanks for calling.

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'A,' 'I'd be happy to bring it to you so you can see it. When would be a good time?' By offering to accommodate the caller, you're best able to overcome the objection and get the appointment.

option.answerText: How about Sunday?
Sure. Just let me get your name and address ...
That's not convenient for me.

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'B,' 'Sure. Just let me get your name and address ...' This is a continuation of the CLOSE step, during which you make arrangements to show the caller the vehicle.

question.text: Okay. My name is Blake Brown. My address is 123 Any Street, in Anytown.

option.answerText: Okay, see you at your house on Saturday, say around 2 p.m. If something comes up, will you call me?
Can I bring my kids with me?
The dealership is open from 10 until 3 Saturday.

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'A,' 'Okay, see you at your house on Saturday, say around 2 p.m. If something comes up, will you call me?' During the CONFIRM step, you finalize plans with the caller and obtain relevant contact information.

option.answerText: Are you sold on this vehicle?
And, of course, if anything changes here, I'll return the courtesy. Your number?
You know, the dealership isn't far from your house.

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'B,' 'And, of course, if anything changes here, I'll return the courtesy. Your number?' During the CONFIRM step, you finalize plans with the caller and obtain relevant contact information.

option.answerText: Do you have any friends who might be in the market for a vehicle?
How about if I just call you next week?
Thanks for calling. I'll see you Saturday at 2 p.m. with the vehicle. By the way, my name is __________ and my direct line is ____________.

answer.incorrectText: The correct response is 'C,' 'Thanks for calling. I'll see you Saturday at 2 p.m. with the vehicle. By the way, my name is __________ and my direct line is ____________.' During the CONFIRM step, you finalize plans with the caller and end the call on a pleasant, positive note.
